definition: to leave office
to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Two years later he retired and became a sports announcer for the NFL.
sentences.chinese: 两年后，他卸任，成了国家足球联盟的播音员。

sentences.english: Mr. Zelaya would also be exempt from prosecution until after leaving office.
sentences.chinese: 塞拉亚先生在卸任前也会免于被起诉。

sentences.english: The armour cropland that already left off his post expresses, do not catch Yang Chengwu to answer country holiday anything but.
sentences.chinese: 已卸任的甲田表示，抓不到杨成武决不回国度假。

sentences.english: I had only six months to go as President.
sentences.chinese: 离我卸任总统之职还有仅仅六个月了。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Maduro insists that he will remain in office until his term expires in 2019.
sentences.chinese: 然而，马杜罗坚持完成任期直到2019年卸任。

sentences.english: Why the outgoing President's felicitation on the indorsement?
sentences.chinese: 为什么卸任总统要对人民的支持巧言美语？

sentences.english: Bush is now back in Texas, living a low-profile post-presidential existence.
sentences.chinese: 现在布什已经返回德州家中，过着卸任后的低调生活。

definition: to leave office/to leave one's post
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
to take office/to assume a post
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to take office/previous (incumbent)/predecessor
term of office/CL:屆|届[jie4]/tenure (entire period in office)
to leave office
to succeed sb in a job/successor
post/position/job/duties
to be promoted to
to resign/to quit
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
to transfer/to move to another post
to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
